record.dc:title: 66GP22, 15GP22, Greenup County, Kentucky. Hardin Village. Irregular Pits, Feature 29, 30.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Fort Ancient Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: Close-up of two irregular pits, Feature 29 on left, 30 on right. Although these look like root-holes, resulting from overturned stumps, evidence is that they were deliberately dug in this shape. Feature 29: Irregular pit, sloping from edges to interior straight-walled pit, with several grooves and holes between this edge and the external boundaries. Filled with dark brown soil. Feature 30: Pit of extremely irregular outline, sloping to central, straight sided hole. Filled with dark brownish dirt. Significance of either pit not apparent.
record.wpa:comments: More information, including diagram, available at institution.
